contest-event.event-date:
Sept. 2, 1861 D Belle Vue Brass Band Contest
British Open 1 Test Piece Contest
british-open
Set Test and Own Choice
Satanella [arr. Hird]
Belle Vue, Manchester, Greater Manchester, England, UK Satanella plus own-choice test piece
All Bands played an Own Choice test piece Prizes: 1st: £35 2nd: £15 3rd: £8 4th: £4.10 5th: £2.10
Source: Manchester Times (Manchester, England), Saturday, September 7, 1861; Issue 196.
This original report contradicts what is given in the 4BR archive on several counts, most importantly regarding the Deepcar band, which the original report makes clear was the same band as the "Stockbridge Works" band. 4BR lists these as separate bands, giving each a draw number and a conductor for only "Stockbridge Works" ("H. Biltcliffe") who is not attested in this original source.
March 21, 2011, 6:11 p.m. Oct. 26, 2014, 10:12 a.m.
1 Halifax Isaac Dewhurst Nabucodonosor - Overture [unknown arranger]
2 Dewsbury Rifle Corps John Peel Robin Hood [MacFarren, unknown arranger]
3 Chesterfield Rifle Corps Band Thomas Tallis Trimnell William Tell [unknown arranger]
4 Sherwood Rangers William Lilley Ernani [unknown arranger]
5 Victoria Volunteer Rifles (Paddington) T. Mackroy Dinorah [unknown arranger]
Unknown Result Delph Band John Brook
Unknown Result Stocksbridge Works (Deepcar) H. Castle
Withdrawn Deighton Unknown
Withdrawn Yorkshire Evening Post Band Richard Smith
